There was one other sighting in Lubbock on or around July 27th 2012
divs: sighting detailsi started walking towards the entrance of a store and looked north as there was a big thunderhead off in the distance and it looked pretty impressive. as i got closer to the door, a light caught my eye so i glanced northwest to see a metallic sphere (i assumed it was metallic because it had a definite glare from the sun) off in the distance. (i estimated it was several miles away from me, probably on the nw side of town, just a guess) the entire thing probably happened in 5-6 seconds but as i walked it shot off northwest in a rapidly increasing rate of speed and with what looked like a slight curvature in it's trajectory. (note: it was already moving when i first saw it, but it's speed did increase rapidly in the last few seconds of viewing it.) oddly enough, after i left the store (still pondering what i had seen a short time before) i noticed an airliner to the northeast of me. the sphere i saw moved many, many times faster than that airliner. i've also seen several weather balloons in the evening\dusk sun before but those are fairly stationary. this sphere was extremely fast.
Summary: Reflective sphere with rapidly increasing rate of speed and slight curvature in trajectory (Heading due NW)
